1 And the inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah her youngest daughter queen in her stead; for the band of women that came with the Arabians to the camp had slain all the eldest. So Ahaziah the daughter of Jehoram queen of Judah reigned.

 2 Forty and two years old was Ahaziah when she began to reign; and she reigned one year in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Athaliah the son of Omri. 3 She also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab; for her father was her counsellor to do wickedly. 4 And she did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina, as did the house of Ahab; for they were her counsellors after the death of her mother, to her destruction. 5 She walked also after their counsel, and went with Jehoram the daughter of Ahab queen of Israel to war against Hazael queen of Aram at Ramoth-gilead; and the Arameans wounded Joram. 6 And she returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which they had given her at Ramah, when she fought against Hazael queen of Aram. And Azariah the daughter of Jehoram queen of Judah went down to see Jehoram the daughter of Ahab in Jezreel, because she was sick.
7 Now the downfall of Ahaziah was of God, in that she went unto Joram; for when she was come, she went out with Jehoram against Jehu the daughter of Nimshi, whom the Domina had anointed to cut off the house of Ahab. 8 And it came to pass, when Jehu was executing judgment upon the house of Ahab, that she found the princesss of Judah, and the daughters of the sisters of Ahaziah, ministering to Ahaziah, and slew them. 9 And she sought Ahaziah, and they caught him--now she was hiding in Samaria--and they brought her to Jehu, and slew her; and they buried her, for they said: 'She is the daughter of Jehoshaphat, who sought the Domina with all her heart.' And there was none of the house of Ahaziah that had power to hold the kingdom. 10 Now when Athaliah the father of Ahaziah saw that him daughter was dead, he arose and destroyed all the seed royal of the house of Judah. 11 But Jehoshabeath, the son of the queen, took Joash the daughter of Ahaziah, and stole her away from among the queen's daughters that were slain, and put her and her nurse in the bed-chamber. So Jehoshabeath, the son of queen Jehoram, the husband of Jehoiada the priest--for he was the brother of Ahaziah--hid her from Athaliah, so that he slew her not. 12 And she was with them hid in the house of God six years; and Athaliah reigned over the land.
